channelUxMap.body:
<% // variables definition
var statusCode = 0;
var answerSuccess = "Your password was successfully changed.";
var answerError = [
    "Something went wrong, but don't worry - let's give it another shot.",
    "Sorry... It was not possible to change your password. Please, try again.",
    "It seems it's not working. Let's do it in another way."
];
var errorControl = +BotUserSession.get("ResetPassword_errorControl");
var quickReplies = [];
var message = {};
var messageText;


// check the result of the response
if (response && response.status) {
    statusCode = +response.status;
}

// SUCCESS
if (statusCode == 200) {
    messageText = answerSuccess;
        
    message = {
        "type":"template",
        "payload": {
            "template_type":"quick_replies",
            "text": messageText,
            "quick_replies": [{
                "content_type":"text",
                "title":"😠",
                "payload":"poor"
            },
            {
                "content_type":"text",
                "title":"😞",
                "payload":"bad"
            },
            {
                "content_type":"text",
                "title":"😐",
                "payload":"average"
            },
            {
                "content_type":"text",
                "title":"😊",
                "payload":"good"
            },
            {
                "content_type":"text",
                "title":"😍",
                "payload":"excelent"
            }
        ]}
    };
    
    BotUserSession.put("Feedback_controlFlag", 0, 1);
    BotUserSession.put("ResetPassword_controlFlag", 0, 2);
    BotUserSession.put("ResetPassword_errorControl", 0, 2);
} else {
    
    if (statusCode == 400 /*&& (!response.errors || response.errors.length === 0)*/) { // validation
       let contentMsg = content[response.messages[0]];
       if (contentMsg) {
            messageText = contentMsg;
       } else {
            messageText = response.messages[0];
       }
       errorControl = 0;
    } else {
        if (errorControl && errorControl > 0) {
            errorControl = errorControl + 1;
        } else {
            errorControl = 1;
        } 
        messageText = answerError[errorControl - 1];
    }

    if (errorControl < 3) {
        quickReplies = ["Change Password"];  
        BotUserSession.put("ResetPassword_errorControl", errorControl, 2);
    } else {
        quickReplies = ["Reset Password"];
        BotUserSession.put("ResetPassword_controlFlag", 1, 2);
        BotUserSession.put("ResetPassword_errorControl", 0, 2);
    }

    message = {
        "type": "template",
        "payload": {
            "template_type": "quick_replies",
            "text": messageText,
            "quick_replies": []
        }
    };

    for (i = 0; i < quickReplies.length; i++) {
        var quickReply = {
            "content_type": "text",
            "title": quickReplies[i],
            "payload": quickReplies[i],
        };
        message.payload.quick_replies.push(quickReply);
    }
    
}
print(JSON.stringify(message)); %>

faqs.question: How to raise a new communication?

alternateQuestions.question: How to send a new communication?
How to create a new communication?
How to handle a new communication?
raise communication
How to create a communication

answer.text:
A new communication is always related to a service. 
*1.* Go to Services Portfolio
*2.* Search for your Application/Service
*3.* Click in your service to open 
*4.* At the top left, click in "Communication Portal"
*5.* A form will open
*6.* Fulfill the form with mandatory info:
 - Select the DL. If you don't find your DL, it's possible to create a New DL from the button "Create a New DL"
 - Select the Severity Level
 - Select the Incident Type
 - Select the Notification Status
 - Enter Start and End dates and times
 - Select the time zone
 - Enter a description 
 - Select the impacted zones 
*7.* Click in "Preview" – a non-formatted box will appear simulating your communication and will pop up a tab showing the number of users that will receive the comm (sanity check);
*8.* If everything is good, click in "Save and Send email".
*9.* If need to change something, click in "Close preview" and got back to step 6.
*10.* Communication is sent and stored in the system.

All set, your contacts have been added to the Distribution List!

faqs.question: How to create a new Service?

alternateQuestions.question: How to add a new Service?
How to open a new Service?
How to create a Service?

answer.text:
Note: Feature available only for Portfolio Managers. 
*1.* Go to Service Portfolio
*2.* Click in New button and a selection type will open
*3.* Select the correct type of service and click Next button 
*4.* According to the type of service, the form will open with different fields.  
*5.* For Business Applications, Platform and Add-on fill in the mandatory fields:
 - *Service name:* Service name related to an application 
 - *Short description:* add a short description for the application 
 - *Zone:* which zone is the responsible for the application 
 - *Status zone:* select the zone that is using the application.
 - *Managed by:* select the tower responsible for the application
 - *Business Functions:* select the correct business function for the application 
 - *Level of customization:* if the application is off the shelf or customized 
 - *Hosting type:* type of hosting of the application 
 - *Crown Jewel:* if the application belongs to the crown jewels of the company
 - *Personal Data:* if the application contains personal data
 - *Criticality:* level of criticality from BIA 
 - *External facing:* if the application has access to internet
- *Financial Reporting:* if the application has any relation to financial reporting (SOX or Statutory) 
*6.* Click ""Save""  and the new service is created 
*7.* Check which is the correct owner for the application and change it. The owner needs to be an user in App360.

faqs.question: What is outlook signature and how do I use it?

alternateQuestions.question: How to use signature in an email?
What is outlook signature?

answer.text: You can use a signature to automatically add text to the messages you send. For example, you can create a signature that includes your name, job title, and phone number.

faqs.question: How to create signature in Outlook?

alternateQuestions.question: How to automatically create a signature to messages in Microsoft Outlook?
How to create an email signature in Outlook?
How do I create an email signature?
How do I create a signature in Outlook?
How to create my signature in Outlook?
How can I create a signature to emails sent using Outlook?
How do I create signature?
How can I create signature in Outlook for Office 365?

answer.text:
OK. I can help you showing the steps to be followed to create your signature. Please check it out:

1. Open a *new email* message.
2. On the *Message* menu, select *Signature > Signatures*.
3. Under *Select signature* to edit, choose *New*, and in the *New Signature* dialog box, type a name for the signature.
4. Under *Edit signature*, compose your signature.You can change fonts, font color, and sizes, as well as text alignment.
5. Choose *OK*, to save your new signature and return to your message.

faqs.question: How to sign an email?

alternateQuestions.question: How can I create a signature by default?
How can I have my signature added to all new messages by default?
How to set the default signature in Outlook?
How to create a custom Outlook email signature?
How do I get Outlook to automatically show my signature?
How do I get my signature to show up in Outlook?
How do I make my signature appear in Outlook?

answer.text:
OK. I can help you showing the steps to be followed. Please check it out:

1. Open a *new email* message.
2. On the *Message menu*, select *Signature > Signatures*.
3. Under *New messages drop-down box, select one of your signatures*.
4. Choose *OK* to save your change and return to your message.

faqs.question: How to create a new vendor entry?

alternateQuestions.question: How to manage a new vendor entry?
How to add a vendor entry?
i want to create a vendor in app360

answer.text:
Note: Feature available for Contract, Service and Contract Managers, Portfolio Managers and Financial Managers.
*1.* Go to Vendors Database (Accounts in the top menu)
*2.* Click in New button and a selection type will open
*3.* Select “Vendor and others” and click Next button 
*4.* A new form will open. You’ll need a few data before filling this form.  
*5.* Fill in the fields: 
 - *Parent account:* relate this account to a parent account, if necessary. Ex: Infosys has many names of Legal entity. An account “Infosys” was created and should be the Parent Account. 
 - *Account name:* mandatory field. Enter the full name of legal entity for this vendor. Usually this information you’ll get from a formal document from the vendor. Ex: Infosys has one legal entity that is called “Infosys Limited” and this is the account name. 
 - *ABI Vendor owner:* select the owner for this vendor (not mandatory) 
 - *Vendor payment type:* There are 4 options: basware, budexchange, Standard (Mail invoicing) and multiple. Basware and Budexchange are online portals that allows the company to send and receive financial information electronically. Standard type is when ABI received invoices by email. Multiple is for the vendor that has more than one type of vendor payment type. 
 - *Payment terms:* enter the payment term in days. Usually this input comes from SAP system. 
 - *Vendor SAP code:* add the SAP code. Needs the input from SAP system.  
 - *Vendor Service Manager:* add the contact related to the vendor as Service Manager. If you didn’t create it, you can click on “New Contact” and a new contact form will appear.
 - *Vendor Finance Manager:* add the contact related to the vendor as Finance Manager. If you didn’t create it, you can click on “New Contact” and a new contact form will appear. 
 - *Vendor Account Manager:* add the contact related to the vendor as Account Manager. If you didn’t create it, you can click on “New Contact” and a new contact form will appear. 
*6.* Click Save button and a new vendor is created.
*7.* If you want to create a new, you can click on Save & New button and a new form will appear.

faqs.question: How do I add a shared mailbox to Outlook?

alternateQuestions.question: Add Shared Mailbox to Outlook

answer.text:
If your admin only recently added you to a shared mailbox, it may take a few minutes before the shared mailbox appears. Wait a bit and then close and restart Outlook again.

If that didn't work, then manually add the shared mailbox to Outlook:

*1.* Open Outlook
*2.* Choose the *File* tab in the ribbon
*3.* *Account Settings*, then select *Account Settings* from the menu
*4.* Select the Email tab
*5.* Make sure the correct account is highlighted, then choose *Change*
*6.* More Settings > Advanced > Add
Type the shared email address
*7.* Choose OK > OK
*8.* Next > Finish > Close

You're all set!

faqs.question: What happens after the MICS Attestation process?

answer.text: Compliance team will use the information in the inventory to understand which services needs to be closely monitored in the MICS Assessment.

faqs.question: What is a service?

answer.text: A service can be a Business Application, Platform, Infra component, Add-on, Workspace/Model, Module, Website or a Mobile Application. Basically a service is an IT item.

faqs.question: What kind of information exists inside a service in the inventory?

answer.text: There are a lot of information for each service, such as basic, functional and technical information, compliance, lifecycle strategy and support.

faqs.question: What is the connection between Budget, Service and Contract?

answer.text: According to the process, all budget lines need to be associated to a Service and to a contract (or internal agreement). So in order to start the process, you need to make sure there is a contract already created (please check section “How to create a contract?” in this doc).

faqs.question: Who is responsible and able to do edit the Service?

answer.text: The owner of the service is the person responsible to edit and maintain correct information related to it, so this person is only person with access to edit the service inside App360.

faqs.question: What is External facing?

answer.text: This is one of the risk criteria’s for compliance. This is an indication whether the service is exposing our network and is accessible from internet

faqs.question: What is Financial Reporting relevance?

answer.text: This is one of the risk criteria’s for compliance.  Indicate which financial reporting the service supports (SOX or Statutory reporting)

faqs.question: What is Criticality?

answer.text: This is one of the risk criteria’s for compliance. Importance of operation for the company according to the Business Impact Assessment (BIA).

faqs.question: What is Personal Data?

answer.text: This is one of the risk criteria’s for compliance.  This is an indication whether the service holds or processes personal data.

faqs.question: What is Crown Jewel?

answer.text: This is one of the risk criteria’s for compliance. This is an indication whether the service contains critical business data and must be protected with additional measures

faqs.question: What are the mandatory fields in Service?

answer.text:
For Business Applications, Infra component, Module, Platform, Workspace/Model and Add-on mandatory fields are: Service name, Short description, Zone, Status (all zones), Area, Business Function, Level of customization, Hosting type, Crown Jewel, Personal Data, Criticality, External facing, Financial Reporting relevance, Time, Pace Layer, Decommissioning Strategy and 1YP status.
For Websites and Mobile apps, mandatory fields are: Service name, Short description, Zone, Status Business Function, Crown Jewel, Personal Data, Criticality, External facing and Financial Reporting relevance.

faqs.question: How do I know if the MICS Attestation process started?

answer.text: In the Service review phase, if you are a service owner, you will receive an email from App360 notifiying that the process has started. In the Risk Criteria's approval phase, you will receive a noticification if you are one of the approvers.

faqs.question: What is MICS Attestation?

answer.text: MICS Attestation process consists on the revision of the entire GHQ IT Solutions Inventory and all information in it. Based on the MICS IT_INV_01- IT control this review needs to occur every quarter. There are two phases of this process. The first one is the inventory revision by the Service Owners and the second is the inventory revision and sign off by the risk criteria’s approval.

faqs.question: Who is responsible to do the MICS Attestation service review?

answer.text: Person responsible for the service review in the MICS Attestation is the Service Owner only.

faqs.question: What if I don't have all information required during the MICS Attestation process?

answer.text: You should put inside the inventory information with the best quality you have at the moment. But you can change all fields in the inventory at any time, not only during the Attestation process.

faqs.question: I received an e-mail to perform the MICS Attestation process, but I am not the correct owner of this item. How should I proceed?

answer.text: If the correct owner already has access to App360, you can go into the service and change the owner in the "owner" field. If the person doesn't have access yet, please contact the Portfolio Manager to help with this request.

faqs.question: What is the MICs Categorization in services?

answer.text: This categorization defines whether the application is critical or not for the company. This will influence the activities performed by Global and Zone IT Compliance teams. All services will have a categorization of MICs defined by global compliance, regarding specific criteria.

faqs.question: I am not able to add fields in the ''List View''. Could I have access to customize my List Views?

answer.text: It is not possible to edit existing views but you can create your own view and manage it. If you need more information, you can check in the Step-by-step session the item How can I create a filtered view with my preferences?

faqs.question: What is “Rate conversion” in 1YP Budget?

answer.text: This is a button that shows to you the FX rate conversion for the current year, always converting to USD.

faqs.question: If my team in GHQ receives an x-charge from another team in GHQ, who should be responsible for creating the budget and the commitment?

answer.text: The team that receives the x-charge doesn’t need to do the budget and doesn’t need to create a contract. The allocated budget will be handled in the commitments.

faqs.question: What are the contract document types?

answer.text:
MSA (Master Service Agreement): It is considered an umbrella contract. It specifies terms and conditions that will govern future transaction or future agreements between both parties. It usually does not contain any amounts to be paid in the period, only rate cards that can be used in future business.
SOW (Statement of Work):  It is a contractual document containing a description of a project's work requirement. It defines project-specific activities, deliverables and timelines for a vendor providing services to the client. The SOW typically also includes detailed requirements and pricing, with standard regulatory and governance terms and conditions. It can also be called Order form.
CR (Change request): It is a contractual document describing the changes to the original document already signed. It can mention changes in the scope, amount, dates or anything previously agreed in the SOW. It can also be called Amendment or Addendum.
Renewal: It is a contractual document used when the original SOW reached its end date, so a renewal of the original one is signed. It can contain the same products and amount, but it can also change, depending on the negotiation.
Quote: It is a quotation sent by the vendor with the amounts to be expected for that services/products. It can also be called Proposal.

faqs.question: What is Vendor payment type inside Account?

answer.text: This is related to how will ABI receive invoices from vendors. Basware and Budexchange are online portals that allows the company to send and receive financial information electronically. Standard type is when ABI received invoices by email.

faqs.question: What is the difference between Accounts and Contacts?

answer.text:
In *Account*, you can see all the contact information about our vendors, as Legal Entity name and SAP code.
In *Contacts*, you can see the contacts related to the accounts. It can be related to ABI or other vendors.

answer.text:
To customize your list view in App360, please follow the steps:

*1.*  Click on the engine logo, at the right of the search bar. (LIST VIEW CONTROLS) 
*2.*  A tab with numerous options will open. Click in “New”.
*3.*  Set a name to your “New List” and choose who can access this list.
*4.*  On the right filter tab or in the "List view Controls", you can “Add Filter” or edit a existing one by clicking on it. It’s possible to add many filters as you like.
* Within this Tab, select Field, Operator and assign a Value accordingly to preferences
* Click "Done" then click on the "Save" Button up top. 
*5.*  Click on the engine logo again, then click “Select Fields to Display”. It’s possible to make specific fields show as columns in your filtered list and organize the order
*6.*  Click on “Add Filter Logic” in case you want to fine tune your results.
*7.*  You can see and access your created lists on the main list selection.

faqs.question: What is 1 year plan Budget?

alternateQuestions.question: What is 1YP Budget stands for?
What's the purpose of 1YP Budget?
1YP Budget
What is 1YP?

answer.text: 1-year plan (1YP) Budget is the planing of the estimated budget for next year. It is created and managed inside App360, based on TCO concept, allowing an easy visibility of cost per service. The budget is synchronized with Anaplan and reflects all information in both systems.

faqs.question: How to create 1YP Budget?

alternateQuestions.question: Where to manage my 1YP Budget?
How to handle 1YP Budget?
create 1YP
how to create a budget?

answer.text:
*1.* Go to 1YP Budget and the page will load
*2.* Select the Year and search for a contract.
(It's necessary to select a contract to create a new budget row).
*3.* Click "Add Row" 
(If there are already budgets created to this contract, it will show the rows).
*4.* Search for the "Service" related to the contract. 
*5.* Select a "product" related to the contract. 
(Unit price will be filled from the product. It was stored in the product record)
*6.* If unit price is not in USD, FX conversion will be applied. It's possible to check the FX rate applied clicking in the button beside Unit Price
*7.* Select "zone" to be applied to this row 
*Quantity:*
 - *Variable products:* the field will be open to enter the quantity. 
 - *Fixed product:* the field will bring the information from the product. 
 - *Contract Amount:* Calculated automatically 
*8.* Enter the "budget amount"
*9.* Click "Save"

Remember: Budgets have a period to create/edit, displayed in the layout. This calendar is defined by Finance team.
Once budget is created, it's possible to enter LE and actuals for each service and contract. 
Budgets will be synchronized with Anaplan.

faqs.question: What is service categorization?

alternateQuestions.question: Service categorization App360

answer.text:
Service Categorization field was created inside the service to provide a clear definition of what is critical for the company based on relevant and audited information in our MICs assessment. 
This categorization defines a standard definition of what is core for ABI and based on that, better decisions can be taken regarding the support and budget along with pre-defined SLAs and KPIs.

faqs.question: How to do the monthly forecast for budget?

alternateQuestions.question: How to do the monthly forecast?

answer.text:
There are 2 options to do the monthly forecast:

*1.* Monthly forecast in the button:
. In this option, you need to click on "Budget Calendarization". 
. It's possible to apply the calendarization for all the rows listed. 
- Add the monthly split in each month and 
- Click  "Apply Calendarization"

*2.* Monthly forecast for each product (row):
- Click the + button in the row, and the months will appear.  
- Add the monthly split in each month 
- Click "Save"
Note: If there is a red color in product, it will indicate that the Budget Amount is not the same as Total Month Amount.

faqs.question: What are the functionalities available in APP360?

answer.text:

* Trigger the process for a new GR request

faqs.question: How should the calendarization (monthly forecast) be made in the budget?

alternateQuestions.question: How should the calendarization be made in the budget?

answer.text: When creating a new budget, by clicking in Monthly Forecast button, you can calendarize the entire contract, spliting the budget amount by month. You can also do the calendarization by each line of the budget, if you want a different approach for that product. All this will be sent to Anaplan and, this way we can have a better visualization of payments calendar.

faqs.question: How Anaplan and App360 are related?

alternateQuestions.question: How App360 is related?

answer.text:
The integration between App360 and Anaplan happend for budget (1YP) and x charge (commitments). The input and approvals will always be in App360, but all information reflects in Anaplan as well.
1YP Budget: Budget will be created and edited in App360, once saved, the data will be send to Anaplan.
Commitment (Cross Charges): Once the commitment is created in App360 and the Service Owner approves it, the inputs will be sent to Anaplan.

faqs.question: What is a Standard Operating Procedure (SOP)?

alternateQuestions.question: What is SOP?

answer.text: A Standard Operating Procedure (SOP) is similar to a step-by-step instruction, compiled in the system to help you with the function that you want to fill or analyze. The SOP aims efficiency, quality output, and reduce miscommunication.

    "payload": {
        "template_type": "button",
        "text": "Note: Feature available only for Contract Managers and Service and Contract Managers.

*1.* Go to Contracts and PO request
*2.* Click in New button and a form will open
*3.* Fill in the fields: 
 - *Vendor:* search for a created vendor. If you didn’t create the vendor yet, click on the “New Account” and another form will open to create the vendor. 
 -*Contract Name:* add a name for the contract. It’s better to add a correspondent name as the document. 
 - *Parent contract:* if necessary, add a parent contract. Search for created contracts, to link to a parent document. Ex: MSA 
 - *Category:* select if it’s a change request, service request, MSA, SOW, Renewal, Order Form, Quote or other. The document usually has a category described. 
 - *Zone:* zone that owns the contract
 - *ABI owner:*search in contacts, select the responsible for this contract. It’s necessary that the contact is created. 
 - *Status:* draft (to contracts that was not signed yet), active (contracts already in place), inactive (contracts not in place anymore). Only the active and draft contracts will be available for budget creation.  
 - *Currency:* currency in the contract
 - *Start/End date:* start and end dates related to the contract. 
 - *Budget Item:* search in Budget Items. Budget Items should already be created by Financial Managers. If not, please contact the Financial Manager (PPM team)
 - *Payment term:* payment term in days for the contract, if available
 - *Automatic renewal:* check if it’s automatic. If not, leave it not checked
 - *Review date:* date to review the contract. If the contract doesn’t have this information, can calculate 3 months earlier from end date contract .
 - *Exit clause:* if there none, add N/A
 - *Comments:* any comments for the contract 
*4.* Click Save button and a New contract is created

faqs.question: What is Cognos?

answer.text:
Cognos is mainly used for Financial Reporting and Consolidation.
The stakeholders are Global Control and FP&A teams.

faqs.question: How to access Cognos?

alternateQuestions.question: Access Cognos
how can i acess cognos
what i have to do to have acess cognos

answer.text: To use Cognos, you need to log in Virtual Desktop via CITRIX.

faqs.question: What is required to request access to Cognos?

alternateQuestions.question: What information do I need before request access to this application?
who can use cognos?
what do i need to get before request acess to cognos

answer.text: To request access to Cognos,  you must have Line Manager approval for Read-only and for Admin access, Line Manager and IT solutions approvals is required.

faqs.question: What is Services Portfolio?

alternateQuestions.question: What is Services Portfolio stands for?
What's the purpose of Service Portfolio?
Services Portfolio

answer.text:
Services Portfolio is the inventory of all IT Services. 
This inventory is the official source for Global Compliance and MICS processes in the company.

faqs.question: How do I track the history and status of my contracts?

answer.text: Follow contract updates and requests selecting the *Contract relations* tab and filter by your contracts.

faqs.question: How do I terminate an existing contract?

answer.text: Only the ABI Contract owner can proceed with this action. Select your contract and in the menu above, click on "Modify / Terminate" and choose the option "Terminate Contract". Afterwards, validate the completed information, attach the Vendor Closing letter signed by the vendor or similar document and of the same validity, and click on "Submit for approval".

faqs.question: What is the Vendor Closing Letter?

alternateQuestions.question: What is VCL?

answer.text:
Vendor closing letter (VCL) is a document validated by Legal which the respective vendor signs and attests that there are no late or open payments by ABI. 
Ensure that there are no financial pending issues before any action is taken in relation to contracts linked to that vendor. It is necessary to sign this document every year, the respective invoices up to the previous year.

faqs.question: How do I get the Vendor Closing Letter Template?

alternateQuestions.question: How to get the VCL template?

answer.text: In the "terminate Contract" option, you can generate the VCL template in the green button. The template automatically brings the information related to the specific contract. Make sure the information is correct.

faqs.question: How do I complete a Termination of a contract?

answer.text: Once the contract termination request achieved the final stage of approval, you need to click on the respective contract, select the option “Modify/Terminate”, then “Terminate” and the updated status of your request will be available. You shall attach the termination letter signed or evidence of the same and then click to finish the termination process. Automatically your contract Status will change to Terminated.

faqs.question: Is there a way to recall the approval?

answer.text:
Only for approvers it is possible to recall during the approval process. 
Recall is not possible after final approval.

faqs.question: What is Annual Spend Threshold?

alternateQuestions.question: What does it mean Annual Spend Threshold?

answer.text: Annual Spend Threshold means the total spend / investment estimated from negotiated vendor in the request.

faqs.question: What happens if I delete a commitment?

alternateQuestions.question: Can I delete a commitment?

answer.text: You can only delete a commitment if the status is draft. Every time a draft commitment is deleted, all the associated features related to it will be deleted.

faqs.question: Who can edit LE lines for the month?

answer.text:
ABI contract owner and PO requestor are allowed to edit LE line for the month. 
PO requestor, can edit just the lines that he/she is the PO requestor, even if he/she is not the owner of the contract.

faqs.question: Which POs are on the LE?

answer.text: The consolidation for the current month is done within the LE period. If a PO number has been added after the LE period is finished, it will be added on the LE records of the next month.

faqs.question: If I cancel a PO, what's happen with the LE?

answer.text: If it is a single PO, during the LE period, the LE record will be delete. If there is a consolidated PO (meaning that there is more than one PO with the same PO number - i.g. PO extension) and one of the PO records is cancelled, the PO record won't be removed from LE line and nothing will change (GR total amount, Monthly GR amount and PO remaining amount). But, if all the related PO records are cancelled or deleted, the LE line will be deleted from the current LE version.

faqs.question: Can I clone commitments?

answer.text: This functionality is available in the new commitment flow for new commitments. Cloning commitments will create commitments without features associated. You will need to associate the features after cloning

faqs.question: Can I clone the features associated to a commitment?

answer.text: This functionality is available in the new commitment flow. In order to clone the features associated to a commitment, the commitments need to be similar (with same start and date) and you can select the commitment where do you want to clone. After cloning the associated features, you'll be able to add more features and edit fields.

faqs.question: When should I create the LE?

alternateQuestions.question: How to manage the LE?
When can I input a LE in the system?

answer.text: The system will have a period that limits the timeline for editing and creating LEs. Every month, the Service Manager can enter and edit LE. From February to November, Service Managers can re-estimate the amounts. The finance team will notify you that the LE period is open (usually in the first days of the month) and you will be able to add your inputs.

faqs.question: What if the contract has already a termination date and I don't do anything?

answer.text:
In case the contract has an end date updated in APP360 and the termination isn’t requested, the contract will became *Inactive* afterwards the end date. However,  it is important to notice that, if the contract is automatically renewed, the service will continue to generate costs unless you formally terminate with the vendor. Hence, ensure that you don’t let any contract active in case the service isn’t necessary or in use to avoid outstanding payments or invoice backlogs for the company. 

*We are a company of Owners!*

faqs.question: What is cross charges?

alternateQuestions.question: Whats cross charges stands for?

answer.text: Cross charge is a sharing of services and costs between different zones and teams inside ABI. Intern services provided by ABI team and/or zone for different areas are negotiated during cross charge period, where people involved get commitment on what you are providing or receiving, which services and the costs involved.

faqs.question: How to edit my menu?

How to manage menu edition?

answer.text:
It's possible to edit the Menu entries, according to the functionalities you want to use or see. 

*1.* In the top right of the menu, click on the pencil icon *Personalize your nav bar*
*2.*  Form will be opened to edit the navigation items
*3.*  Drag the items to up or down to customize your menu
*4.*  If the functionality is not available:
Click *Add More Items* button to add it
*5.*  Once completed, click *Save* 

Done! You have been updated your Menu!
